metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2125 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
RubyGems before 1.8.23 can redirect HTTPS connections to HTTP, which makes it easier for remote attackers to observe or modify a gem during installation via a man-in-the-middle attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2125` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bundler - 3.2.5-2
ruby-bundler - 3.2.5-2
No subscription required

ruby-rubygems - 3.2.5-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rubygems package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.5-2').
rubygems package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.5-2').
